 Supposedly Tuesday's crowd could be 2 million stretched all the way to the Lincoln Memorial (2 miles away!) 

Quite a "change" I'd say.

comment.author: 43008542@N00
comment._content:
I miss President Reagan.

It's interesting to see the military immediately giving their salute to their new CinC at this point after the swearing in.

Billy Graham gave a great prayer that day.

I imagine George W Bush has been to every Presidential inauguration since 1980, on the review stand, as Governor's are also on the main stand, and he would have been there in '96 as well.

President Bush used the Washington Bible that day.

I believe it is a fairly recent occurrence for former Presidents to appear at the inauguration, and this year was the first that I remember that former Vice President's have appeared. The platform has gotten larger and larger, and it could have never gotten that large while the inauguration was on the east front of the Capitol.
